website_summaries.verdict: As Blu-ray players go, the Samsung BD-C6900 is pretty amazing. It's got all the usual features, like BD-Live and lovely lossless audio, but it also packs in Internet TV streaming and 3D capability. It costs significantly more than a normal Blu-ray player, but it's well worth the extra, and, if you're a 3D fan, it's a must-own device

customer_reviews.title: Poor Support
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, Samsung stopped providing firmware updates in 2013. This means newer discs won’t play. Samsung used to be my go to brand for most electronics, but after issues with TVs, phones and players, I now avoid them. Their customer service is non-existent and they don’t stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: CrabbyDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Samsung BD-C6900 Junk - Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: The Samsung BD-C6900 Blu-ray player is total junk. It failed to play at least 3 first run Blu-ray movies and one DVD movie (Batman Dark Knight Rises). When I call Samsung support they say when a movie first comes out they have to figure out how to decode it and then they write a firmware update. That is totally unacceptable because the whole point of the player is to watch movies when they first come out. I'ts also got an app to stream Netflix downloadable movies and it rarely is able to get through a movie without choking and rebuffering. The simple Roku device hardly ever has a problem.
customer_reviews.author: pcbsmoke

customer_reviews.title: worst setup program ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst setup program I have ever used. If you only need to play Blue-ray disc, it will be fine. The pic quality is pretty good. If you need to connect to Internet, the trouble begins. There has been enough posts and complains about Samsung networking, and it's a PAIN to set it up. After you finally connected to internet, it's another PAIN to set up app account, etc. Not to mention the design of their remote makes it even worse. Again, if you only need to play blue-ray, it will be pretty good. Everything else is such a pain! I don't know how their usability team survived, if they have one.
customer_reviews.author: -J.

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Broke within 2 years of very gentle, light use. This unit was installed in my basement. It was used probably 10 - 20 times before it stopped playing Blu-Ray discs. It is still good for Netflix and DVD's, but it will not read a Blu-Ray disc anymore. After reading online about this model it appears to be low quality junk that breaks quickly for nearly everyone who owns it.
customer_reviews.author: Ribbs

customer_reviews.title: Tempermental
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this Bluray player for a few months now. This thing works when it wants to. Every movie seems to have some kind of issue during the coarse of the movie. I have always had a little bit of an issue with it freezing or not recognizing a disc but after I did an update, this thing has gotten way worse. I will lose the signal, it will freeze, it will sometimes not recognize the disc. I purchased this Samsung to go along with my Samsung TV which works great but the Bluray player leaves a lot to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T SUPPORT 3D BLURAYS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I put in my new Tangled 3D Bluray and it won't play it! It says this Bluray doens't support 3D Blurays. I did the online chat with Samsung.com and they were not helpful at all. It's an issue they are having and I didn't get any real answers. Was told to check back on their website for an announcement. And this is AFTER he made me reset my Bluray player so I lost all my apps and accounts I had entered. Very frustrating. I loved the Bluray player as a regular Bluray player. But to play 3D Blurays, which is what it is designed for, I had to give it one star!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it
customer_reviews.text: It functions. I had high hopes for the apps, streaming Netflix is a great idea. It takes a bit to turn on. The control buttons are sensors so the unit has to be on before you can insert a disk. No immediate gratification here. Occasionally the video goes black, both during playback of DVD's and streaming. Soundtrack often lags picture. These problems have been improved by firmware updates, but still not right. Feature rich, but still needs work to be acceptable. I wouldn't complain if the price was under $100.
customer_reviews.author: CyberMike

customer_reviews.title: Did someone accidentally send me a beta version?
customer_reviews.text: Afraid Samsung rushed to market with this system... lots of bugs yet to be worked out. I just hope Samsung can do it in the coming months through firmware updates. If you're interested in the internet features of this device, you should know that Hulu access is limited to those with Hulu Plus accounts ($10/month) and NetFlix access is limited to items that are already in your streaming list. Thus, it does not come close to being a replacement for the good 'ole desktop/laptop computer.
customer_reviews.author: no_name_6543

customer_reviews.title: This is a winner
customer_reviews.text: This DVD Player has been great. I have had no problems what so ever with this product. Netflix interaction is fabulous. This was the main reason for the purchase. I have tried a couple of product that never interacted very well. The Blu-Ray movies look great on my Samsung T.V. My only negative is that the packaging was poor and it got scratched up a bit during the ups. However, I didn't want to complain since it was Christmas and wanted to use it over the Holidays. Arrived on time
customer_reviews.author: Wayne H

customer_reviews.title: BD-C6900 Refurb was the best bargan!
customer_reviews.text: I already had one of these models. It gave me problems with "The life of PI" 3 D. I looked for any firmware releases for this product and there was a new version released March of 2013. This really cleared up the playing problem and made the whole (boot/playing) time quicker. Definitely a good bargain today.
customer_reviews.author: FastFreddie

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with some wireless routers
customer_reviews.text: It does not work well with some wireless routers (for Netflix), keep on "failed to connect", especially with "802.11n" or some advanced features (like "extend a wireless network" on Apple extreme) on. I am pretty sure this is a firmware issue of Samsung. Googled, and found many people have this issue. BUT samsung blamed on routers. To solve the problem, I got a new/basic router, it works fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Macro

customer_reviews.title: The first DVD player with Hulu+
customer_reviews.text: The Good: It has the easiest and best Netflix interface of any BD player I've tried and returned (beats Sony & Visio). I got this model because it was the only BluRay DVD with a Hulu+ App. I like watching current TV programs on Hulu. It boots up superfast when you power it on. The Bad: There are very few new Internet Apps. I wish it had more Internet TV Apps like "TV.com," Fox, etc. I wish you could customize the layout of your favorite Apps and delete all Apps you don't use. It is very expensive. Built-in WiFi only has 2.4Ghz Wireless N frequencies.
customer_reviews.author: COMCAM

customer_reviews.title: Again Free ain't bad...
customer_reviews.text: This Blu Ray player is pretty quick to load up, plays flawlessly and I love all the other Internet related features, especially Netflix and Pandora. I had an initial problem with Netflix not working, but Samsung finally made an update available that has corrected the problem. This is one of those products you just use and enjoy without having to think too much about it. I'm really enjoying 3D!
customer_reviews.author: William P. Shivers

customer_reviews.title: All my Electronic products are Samsung
customer_reviews.text: Since buying my First Samsung Flat 50" TV I have been impressed with material and functional workmanship. When this DVD Blu-Ray player was first marketed, I thought why not keep functional continuity and I'm glad I did. The player worked so well I now have two. My only regret is unlike the TV the hand remote is not darkness friendly as I really enjoy a remote I can operate on feel alone. Returning the navigation pad to the round design as with the TV would compliment an already great unit. Sunglob 2010
customer_reviews.author: Sunglob

customer_reviews.title: Does not play new BluRay discs. There are no ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not play new BluRay discs. There are no longer firmware updates from Samsung. I do not have this problem with other circa 2010 BluRay players as those brands are thoughtful enough to provide firmware updates. Despite having two other Samsung BD players and multiple Samsung television, I am no longer buying this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Evan W.

customer_reviews.title: ... reasons I bought this was for the ability towatch Netflix, but after a firmware update
customer_reviews.text: One of the main reasons I bought this was for the ability to watch Netflix, but after a firmware update, Nexflix stopped working. I spent hours on the phone with Samsung (and combing through the support website), but was never able to get it fixed. I ended up buying a Sony to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon E

customer_reviews.title: WOW - great 3d DVD Blueray
customer_reviews.text: I don't get people who rated this lower than a 4 or 5. This DVD player is great! I have a samsung TV and they 'talk to each other - ex turn on blue ray play and tv turns on automatically). Picture quality is a+, no glitches found, 3d is fab, and the online stuff you can do via the player is amazing. I purchased because of a packaged deal - but love it - and the design is a+ too very contemporary and sleek!
customer_reviews.author: Lefty

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding 3D Blue Ray DVD Player!
customer_reviews.text: This player is everything Cnet.com said. Super fast on-off and response time compared to other blue ray players. Decent selection of installed and available Aps. I hooked it up to Internet via wire, though it also has built-in wireless. The player gets auto firmware updates. No fuss-no muss. I'm glad I bought this player. The Samsung engineers did a great design job. Kudos!
customer_reviews.author: Doobster

customer_reviews.title: Plays Nice With Samsung TV
customer_reviews.text: Hooking this up to our home network with Samsung TV was almost effortless. The most difficult part of getting it online was entering the network password. Entering it via TV remote took me a few tries because it is case sensitive and I didn't realize I had to select lowercase letters before entering the password. (The default is uppercase.) The rest was automatic.
customer_reviews.author: VHH

customer_reviews.title: Good Player
customer_reviews.text: I have it around two years, and I'm satisfy with this BluRay player. Mostly I using it with Hulu+ and Netflix. I think if you have good Internet like my Comcast around 20mb/sec, and its connected with wire LAN cable- my CAT 6 then its should be fine. I had some complains about Hulu HD in peak times, but I think that is Hulu servers issue. Few moths ego I got LG Smart TV with passive 3D, and in my surprise it play on that TV newest 3d movies with amazing sound- the unit I have connected to Onkyo receiver and delivery sound to 7.1 speakers system, it shaking my house enough to stay home to watch movies.
customer_reviews.author: Chris666

customer_reviews.title: 6 years later, problematic
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 3D blu ray disc player 6 years ago. Within the past 6-9 months, it has had difficulty loading blu ray discs and comes up with an error. According to the settings, its firmware is up to date. Lousy purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Good but Expensive
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy this to watch 3D on my Samsung UN55C8000 LED TV. The model is very slick and light. The touch based controls are good. It loads discs very fast. Except for 3D it is just like any other Blu-ray player. Do hook it up to internet and update the Firmware (regularly). The Internet and Apps are good. The 3D capability is good (Alient vs Monsters) but not impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain hunter

customer_reviews.title: Another Bad One
customer_reviews.text: I have to give this 1 star. It is the third time that Samsung Blu-ray players have lasted less then 3 years. I bought this in 2010. Now that it is the end of 2011 it wants to act up. It plays regular DVD's fine. But when I put in a blu-ray it takes forever to load or it will skip through the blu-ray.
customer_reviews.author: CWB

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: The unit is easy to set up and fairly intuitive to use. Bought it because of internet Apps. The ones installed are not very helpful, except for Netflix. Other Apps versions require you to pay per view, even though there are related Apps that are free. have not yet figured out whether and how to add Apps that are more relevant.
customer_reviews.author: P. L. Landry

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced junk
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Purchased in 2010 and it stopped playing Blu-ray Discs by 2012. It plays DVDs just fine, but this makes me feel like Samsung wasted a bunch of my money on their 3D system.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda L. Chiarelli

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: I use this player with the 46C8000 3D Samsung. A VERY good combination. Had no trouble linking through a wireless router for internet NetFlix, YouTube etc. FiOS at 20 mbps. A screamer. Don't forget the HDMI 1.4 cables. Why load BB's into an elephant gun? Perfect service from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: G. Pealer

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and looked at many reviews for this player. Cnet gave it high ratings and the price at the time was just right. 2 things I don't like about it. Slow to load a disk and slow to connect to my wifi even thought the router is 12 inches away from it.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy F.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I tried to give this item zero stars, but it makes you put something. Plugged it in turned it on and remote would do nothing except work tv functions. You cant set up player w/out the remote! It was obviously the sensor in the player and not the remote. Wont purchase anything refurbished again. Was packed back in box and return label applied within an hour and a half of going crazy trying to get it to work. I wanted this 2010 model because it zooms out black bars on 2:35 content and the 2011 models do not. None do except the Oppo BD93 for $499!! So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jallen

customer_reviews.title: Player stinks! Would never play Blu-ray discs correctly and ...
customer_reviews.text: Player stinks! Would never play Blu-ray discs correctly and I finally had enough and it met Mr. Trash can. Bye Bye...
customer_reviews.author: HB33

customer_reviews.title: Freezing issue from the day I received this blu-ray player.
customer_reviews.text: The DVD player is ok, however it must have some issue because it freezes regularly if whatever it is playing is paused long enough for the screen saver to come on, at which time the screen saver freezes and the player becomes unusable until it is restarted. When that happens, it has to be turned off and rebooted. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow ! easy set up, great for 3 D movies
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this new Samsung 3D Blu-ray player, a simple set up and wifi connection with the first try and I was watching a Blu-ray 3D movie in just minuts. This is my second Samsung Blu-ray I bought especially for my new 3D HDTV set up. it gets a 5 star rating in my book.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kauffmann

customer_reviews.title: 1 Star rating for build quality and Samsung Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I received this in late October as part of a package deal from Amazon along with an LED TV and 3D starter kit. As I already had a BD player and did not have any interest in the 3D functionality I did not open the box until Christmas weekend. This unit was defective out of the box - would not recognize ANY BD or DVD media of any kind. Samsung was not willing to honor the warranty without a $50 labor fee for a item that was defective right out of the box. Amazon CS stepped and made an exception and accepted a return out of policy. Amazon knows how to keep a customer, Samsung just lost a good one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Quick playing DVD's after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I got this player for my birthday and it worked great for the first 4 months. After that it only plays my blu-ray discs half the time, which is always a big hit with my kids. On my third service call with Samsung, they told me something was defective with player. They said I needed to send my player back in for 3 weeks and charged me $50 to look at it. I wouldn't recommend buying this player and I will only buy from a company that will actually stand behind their products going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ulrich

customer_reviews.title: tv flickers just as you turn dvd on
customer_reviews.text: The tv started to flicker as soon as you turn dvd on. Upon playing the video dvd the sound goes to mute every minute. Can't figure out why? I tried using an old dvd from the 80's still doing the same thing. I was thinking it could be cinavia protection that goes wild. This is typical of cinavia problem I have encountered before. I have no recourse but to return it to the seller
customer_reviews.author: perpetra888

customer_reviews.title: Skippedee Do Dah
customer_reviews.text: We have had this player for about 10 months now. It freezes, skips, and drops sync relentlessly... so much that my family refuses to play regular DVDs on it... they play them on the Xbox. For BluRay disks... we just suffer through it... I think I will return it and get an LG or Sony.
customer_reviews.author: BigDaddyRich2U

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Blu-Ray player
customer_reviews.text: I got this as part of a package with the purchase of the new 3D TVs coming out years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jonatan

customer_reviews.title: Samsung 3D Blu-Ray
customer_reviews.text: Makes many traditional DVD's look like a poor quality movie (does great with Blu-Ray and with 3D presentation). Streaming is terrible with my wireless network, and I have it placed right next to my router. Points mentioned are the negatives, but overall I am extremely pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CJC Fam

customer_reviews.title: Samsung blue ray player
customer_reviews.text: Well it came in good condition arrived on time also, I really don't have alot of complaints other than once and awhile it freezes and it won't play the dvd you put in!
customer_reviews.author: cjkgd5

customer_reviews.title: I had to return this item-I ordered it wrong
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really hate it I just ordered the wrong one and had to return it...
customer_reviews.author: E. Baker

customer_reviews.title: expected better from Samsung
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this Blu-ray DVD player puts out a beautiful picture when it's working, but it overheats to the point that it doesn't work anymore. Thank god for Amazon's no hassle returns policy because I had to send my first one back due to the fact that it stopped playing Blu-ray movies. Now with my new one I've propped it up on blocks so it can get good air flow. It looks super cheesy but it seems to help. I expected more for my $400.
customer_reviews.author: The Reaper

customer_reviews.title: Good, Bad and the ?
customer_reviews.text: It's good but the remote is not as equiped as possible, pause does step but only forward. Sony remotes so far have the best step I have found per DVD players!
customer_reviews.author: Hactic Bidster

customer_reviews.title: Iffy player
customer_reviews.text: This player was just way too slow. Had it a while and still have it but we upgraded to a Sony and have been much happier ever since.
customer_reviews.author: oneliberty

customer_reviews.title: Package Deal
customer_reviews.text: Received my PN58C7000, Blue ray starter kit, BD-C6900 player right after Christmas. Very pleased with the TV and the ease of set up with my componets. My disapointment comes with the BD-C6900. Bluray or DVD disc bring up a message of unable to read check disc. 5 stars go to Amazon though for making it very easy to return. Speaking of Amazon very happy with the trucking company that brought my TV into the house and set it on top of its stand.
customer_reviews.author: Valkyrie

customer_reviews.title: Absurd number of bugs
customer_reviews.text: The tray will frequently open while playing a disk, interrupting playback. It will often refuse to read disks, even brand new ones (this can be overcome by repeatedly try to load them, i.e. closing the tray dozens of times over and over). No Amazon Video app. Newer Blu-rays won't play (get an error screen saying an update is required, but neither auto-update or manual update works).
customer_reviews.author: Justin Guinn

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent DVD player
customer_reviews.text: I love this blu-ray DVD player! The picture quality is awesome. The internet connection is super easy as well as the other tools and functions (Netflix, Vudu, YouTube and Pandora media streaming) plus the expandable Samsung Apps platform; built-in Wi-Fi; very fast operational speed.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Blu Ray heaven
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine piece of technology. I am very happy with it. The APPS are great the play back is excellent goes well with my new Sammy 8000!
customer_reviews.author: Wichita

customer_reviews.title: Flaky operation during streaming
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 6 months now. Was working fine and now in the middle of streaming Vudu or Netflix the DVD tray opens and it exits streaming mode. There is no dvd in place and I even put the remote controls in a draw in case one was sending out phantom commands. My guess is it is in their firmware updates as it worked fine for 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine
customer_reviews.text: We picked up this player as our second blu-ray player and it works without any issues. It's relatively fast at starting up and remembers where you left off even if you remove and reinsert the same disk. The Youtube application works relatively well, but don't expect PC-like performance.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great price...1rst step towards 3D....
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Bluray 3D player as the 1rst step towards 3D... Needed a new DVD player and this one plays regular as well as Bluray, 3D,and homegrown....Great picture and sound now all I need is the 3D glasses as I already bought a 55" LED Samsung...Works great but have never seen 3D on it yet so can't rate it for that...
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Heflin

customer_reviews.title: The equipment itself is excellent and plays well
customer_reviews.text: Everything was as mentioned in the ad. The equipment itself is excellent and plays well. The family is happy so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: I have had this item for over a year and it was easy to setup, connect to the internet, stream, etc. I have no issues with it and it plays all my DVD and Blu-Ray disks without issues. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Dark Age Company
customer_reviews.text: The blue ray player will not work with most blue ray discs released in the last 4 months. They sent me one firmware update and that doesn't work. Samsung stated the do not have another update and won't for at least 2 months. Thus, the player is worthless unless I want to play older released movies.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B. Fink

customer_reviews.title: 2 years on with numerous calls to Samsung
customer_reviews.text: ...and no 3D bluRay play capability. Have updated firmware, but will not play 3D and only plays normal BluRay. Not what I paid $360 for a couple years ago.
customer_reviews.author: SPG321

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Easy to Use and Fast Shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy this blu ray player. It was super easy to set up and the quality is great! We are also enjoying the wi fi that is built in. It is the bang for the buck! Will buy from here again! Thank you1
customer_reviews.author: Heather L. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Very happy, So far.
customer_reviews.text: Product does exactly what it is designed to do. I have yet to play a 3D movie on it, I am looking forward to doing so soon. Loads and plays Blu-rays quickly and beautifully. The internet is quick as well, it is connected via Wi-fi to my home network. I love the slim design compared to my old player. I am very satisfied with my purchased and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Ocegueda

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't play AVCHD Video's
customer_reviews.text: Too expensive to just play blu-rays, should also be able to play AVCHD video's like what's on
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Lots of bells.
customer_reviews.text: I can not find any problems with this device. Still to use the 3D, bought the unit for future improvements of my media center.
customer_reviews.author: BILBERRY

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It was ready to go out of the box, setting up the wireless was a breeze, it took a little bit to upload latest software, but I have been a netflix watching fool since I got it...Now I'm just waiting for HULU Plus.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!!
customer_reviews.text: This player performs 3d playback very well!! No complaints. It has a screen saver function so there is no risk of burn-in on a plasma tv. A very nice feature!!
customer_reviews.author: jmrekieta

customer_reviews.title: Dead BD-C6900 player
customer_reviews.text: unit WAS very slow to load, now out of warranty and dead, stopped playing blu-ray first, now won't even play DVD's. had it just over a year.
customer_reviews.author: ridn2

customer_reviews.title: Best of the rest!
customer_reviews.text: Too many things to say. You must try it out. "UNBELIEVABLE" internet connections. Mel Pearson
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: This Blueray player not only plays Blueray discswell but upgrade all other so that they lokk "digitally remastered" Yes even 1930 movies. Definately a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Bruce Mackler

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: It has been two years since I started using this player. It still works well. The appearance and design look great! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Life_is_a_Choice

customer_reviews.title: Where's the option to start play from last position???
customer_reviews.text: I'm updating my review from 2 stars to 4 as Chuck pointed out this lack of functionality is due to the discs - not the player. All of my DVDs (Panasonic, Sony, GE, Toshiba) have this capability to replay from the last position that was stopped. I can't find this in this player. Otherwise, it's a good player. The setup menu is for the TV setting? What the heck???
customer_reviews.author: Steven V

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy this player
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from Amazon and there were scratches on the black glossy surface, i think that this BD was used before. And when i playing a movie, dvd or blu-ray suddenly there stop or turn slowly, the performance of this product is too bad. Would not buy this player , i strongly recomend search another alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Burbano

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, Great Performance, Great Features - Best Player in the market
customer_reviews.text: Great Bluray player with plenty of features, very fast loading and operation. Best in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Venkatesh Karuppanan

customer_reviews.title: Won't play any disc..
customer_reviews.text: Got it with my new 55inch led. Never was able to play any disc. Waiting for replacement. Highly disappointed. My first time getting a totally defective item. On the bright side, 55inch led is working fantastic. No wonder this player is getting subpar reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Scratched surface.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from Amazon and there were scratches on the black glossy surface. Amazon replaced it three times and each time the surface was all scratched up. Unsure why a $400 3d blue ray disc player should come with scratches on the shiny top surface all 3 times. Amazon customer service was very courteous and professional so far. Am returning the 3rd player today and waiting for the refund. Would not buy this player even though the picture quality is good because of the cosmetic problem.
customer_reviews.author: third dimension

product_meta.title: Samsung BD-C6900 1080p 3D Blu-ray Disc Player (2010 Model)
product_meta.description:
The Samsung BD-C6900 Blu-ray 3D DiscPlayer allows you to see vivid dimensions in picture depth and action that both leaps off the screen, and draws you deep into the experience. Enjoy the superior picture quality and brilliant color of Full HD 1080p in a way you’ve never seen it before.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


3D TECHNOLOGY CHECKLIST
This product is 3D-related. To help you get a great 3D experience, use our checklist below to ensure that you have everything you need. If you have any questions or want to learn more about 3D, we invite you to visit 3D 101--our center for everything 3D. To get started with 3D, please ensure that you have:

A DISPLAY
The first--and most important--item you'll need is a 3D-ready display--whether it be a 3D HDTV, 3D projector, or 3D computer monitor. These displays usually have a higher processing power than older models as they need to display one image for each eye to create a 3D effect. 


A SOURCE
While your display is ready for 3D playback, you still need a device to read 3D content (i.e., a movie or a show). This source can be a cable box with a subscription to a 3D channel, a 3D Blu-ray Disc player, or a PlayStation 3. 


CONTENT
In order to watch 3D, you will need to get some 3D content. This 3D content will come from the source mentioned above in the form of a 3D program, movie, or game. Please ensure that your 3D movies are in the Blu-ray 3D format, as this new format will provide the best 3D experience. 


3D GLASSES
All 3D HDTVs on the market require Active Shutter glasses to create the 3D effect. You will need to buy one pair of glasses for each viewer. Also make sure that the Active Shutter glasses you buy are compatible with your display--for example, buy the glasses from the same brand as your 3D HDTV. 


HDMI CABLE
To connect your source (such as a 3D Blu-ray Disc player) to your display, you'll need a hgh-speed HDMI cable. Cables with this designation--with bandwidth speeds up to 10.2 Gbps (gigabits per second)--will be able to carry the 3D signal without any loss of quality. If you want to get more information about 3D, shop our 3D products, watch videos, or interact with other customers, visit 3D 101, our customer center about everything 3D.




BD-C6900 Blu-ray Player FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Samsung BD-C6900 Blu-ray 3D DiscPlayer allows you to see vivid dimensions in picture depth and action that both leaps off the screen, and draws you deep into the experience. Enjoy the superior picture quality and brilliant color of Full HD 1080p in a way you’ve never seen it before. 1080p Up-conversion optimizes resolution, for better viewing. Samsung Apps like BLOCKBUSTER, YouTube, Netflix, Twitter and Facebook, built for your Blu-ray, let you stream video, play games, view pictures and more. Built-in WiFi allows you to wirelessly access pictures and music from your PC and stream content, including apps, straight to your Samsung Blu-ray Player. BDLive connects to exciting online content, providing countless hours of additional digital entertainment. The BD-C6900 has a sleek, black design that adds a beautiful, modern look to your décor.  




Built with advanced 3D technology, the BD-C6900 features 3D Full HD 1080p image quality. 3D technology opens the door to a new level of action that leaps right off the screen.



KEY FEATURES

 * Internet@TV: Connect to an ever-expanding portal of your favorite digital content. Customizable widgets give you access to BLOCKBUSTER, Facebook, YouTube, Flickr, and more – all on your HDTV.

BD-Live 2.0 lets studios future-proof their Blu-ray titles, so they can add content to BD-Live Ready discs even after they have been shipped. Simply connect your Blu-ray player to the Internet (through the included Ethernet port or using an optional Link Stick USB wireless dongle) to download images, subtitles and more. LEARN MORE



3D AT HOME

See vivid new dimensions in picture depth and action that leaps off the TV screen. The Samsung 3D experience* is:
• Watching 3D movies and shows on a Samsung 3D TV with stylish and comfortable 3D Active glasses.
• Connecting a Samsung 3D Blu-ray Disc Player immerses you in the latest Hollywood 3D hits.

* 3D viewing experience depends on source of 3D content. Samsung 3D TVs are compatible with the Blu-ray Disc Association standard and both broadcast standards. 



INTERNET-CONNECTED

Choose apps built for your TV that let you stream video, play games, view pictures and more.
• Video: BLOCKBUSTER (new movie releases), YouTube (user-generated content) and Netflix (instantly stream TV shows and movies).
• Games: Monopoly from EA, interactive card games and more.
• Lifestyle: Facebook (social networking), Twitter (conversations and updates), Pandora (personalized internet radio) and more.
• Sports and News: the latest headlines and more from Associated Press and USA Today. 


ULTRA FAST PLAY

At Samsung we believe there's always room for improvement. We applied this philosophy to eradicating the time it takes for a movie to actually start after inserting a disc into a Blu-ray or DVD player. Our BD-C6900 was engineered with Ultra Fast Play to eliminate those annoying load times. It gets you into the entertainment right away. So sitting down to watch your favorite drama no longer entails the drama of slow device booting and clumsy tray openings. 





SLEEK DESIGN

The BD-C6900 boasts a design that's both modernized and minimized, making it as much a part of your living room as it is your home theater system. With both TOP disc lighting and blue lighting, its logo shines when the player reads discs. Only 1.5" high, the BD-C6900's slim body hides the disc loading door, but through its cool transparent window on top you can see what disc is playing. Factor in its sleek, chic metal finish and there's no doubt that this player has the high-end looks to match its high-end performance. 


ALLSHARE

Now you can enjoy music, movies and photos from your PC and mobile devices, right on your Samsung TV screen. With the BD-C6900's AllShare, wirelessly sync your PC or Samsung mobile phone with your TV, streaming content and even keeping tabs on who's calling and texting you with real-time monitoring on your screen. Samsung's AllShare makes staying connected easy.







SCREEN FIT

To maximize your viewing experience, to truly feel the power of on-screen portrayals, you need all the picture you can get. With the Screen Fit feature, the BD-C6900 Blu-ray disc player automatically converts 21:9 aspect ratio movies to 16:9 aspect, eliminating those annoying black bands crowding the scenes. Watch movies the way they were meant to be seen--with just one touch of the Screen Fit button. 


UPGRADE

Breathe new life into your movie collection with the BD-C6900 and upscale your standard definition DVDs into high resolution DVDs. Your favorite DVDs will feature the same brilliant details and rich, robust colors you've come to enjoy from the high definition content on your HDTV.







ANYNET+

Anynet+ is an AV Network system to automatically control Samsung Audio/Video (AV) devices. There is no need to use different remote controls for different devices. With the Anynet+ feature, all you need is one remote control for a simple and convenient experience.
